text:
Julie Gibson (September 6, 1913 – October 2, 2019) was an American former singer and actress. Her career during became popular in the 1940s.
In 1937, she joined the cast of Joe Penner's radio program.
She made her first movie appearances in small roles in the movies "Nice Girl?" and "The Feminine Touch" (both 1941).
Her first featured role was in the 1944 movie "Lucky Cowboy".
Gibson died at her Los Angeles home on October 2, 2019 at the age of 106.
